channel.title: [RuneSource] Xstream error
channel.description: Hello, so i have recently come back to RSPS after a few years and would love to have a go with RuneSource as it is stable and fairly easy to write code for.. Only thing is, i cannot get ANY source that uses RuneSource as a base to run?! I've tried RuneSource original by blake, Stonefall, RuneFocus, the leaked 2006Scape source, and many more, and all of them just give similar errors no matter what I try... I have tried to update the Xstream, tried to fix the alias of ItemDef (because that's generally the error i get) I have tried changing JDK/JRE versions, I have added the correct run arguments, I have tried allot of things that i have found from searching deep into this error and none of them have worked for me so far.. So I was just wondering if someone could just tell me how to actually successfully run a PLAIN coppy of RuneSource and what requirements I need because this is really starting to P*** me off... Thank you :)

item.title: [RuneSource] Xstream error
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

ProTayToe:

You, sir… Are a life saver >_< a whole week i have been getting errors from multiple RuneSource based sources and THIS was the issue! I feel very stupid right now… Thank You!

The compiler even told you the error…

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Xstream error
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

are you sure you’re importing the project properly into eclipse? make sure the ‘plugin’ folder is a source folder.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Xstream error
item.dc:creator: @ProTayToe ProTayToe
item.description:
@ProTayToe wrote:

Hey, I am very sorry for the late reply! Anyway, so a fresh copy of RuneSource while using the Run.bat that it comes with says this:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247) Could not find the main class: Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Then when i use Eclipse IDE i get this:

[18/01/13 00:27]: Starting RuneSource on /127.0.0.1:43594... java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: SamplePlugin at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.lang.Class.forName(Unknown Source) at PluginHandler.loadPlugins(PluginHandler.java:64) at Server.run(Server.java:90) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

I was using JRE7 while getting these errors.

This is what is on line 64 on PluginHandler.java:

and this is what is on line 90 in Server.java:

Hope this can tell you something because I really like the way RuneSource works but I feel that i am trying to fix something that isn’t broken and is just purely something wrong like the wrong Java version or something.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Xstream error

item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

what’s the error… the original runesource shouldn’t give you Xstream errors. XML sucks, just use CFG
